page.title: 09Keverstone Grange. 1.
page.content: This farm is part of the large Raby estate,and is nearly 200 years old.The Littlefair family have been working the land for about 100 years.Before Keverstone Grange became a farm house it used to be the residence of Lord Barnard's agent.The tenants of his Raby Estate came to the house to pay their rents etc.It's a surprisingly big house made entirely of stone.The walls are very thick.The original farm house nearby is much smaller and is now let.The house is divided into two parts.The front rooms being for the family whilst the back,with its own staircase,would be for servants.At the back there are two courtyards bordered by old stone buildings which are still used.In the office courtyard we saw a mounting block,which would be used in days when tenants came on horseback to see the agent.
